key_points: A MacArthur High School student was arrested after brandishing a loaded gun at another student during an argument in the gym locker room.
The incident occurred on Thursday morning, and the student with the gun has since been arrested without any shots being fired.
Following the incident, the school was placed on secure status and extra Aldine ISD police officers were dispatched to the campus.
Aldine ISD has stated that the safety of students and staff is their top priority and that disciplinary action will be taken according to the district's student code of conduct.
The Aldine ISD Police Department is conducting an investigation into the incident.
The event follows a deadly school shooting in Michigan earlier the same week where 15-year-old Ethan Crumbley killed four students and injured seven others.
Ethan Crumbley has been charged as an adult, while his parents face charges of involuntary manslaughter for their alleged negligence.
On the same day as the Michigan shooting, another student at Cinco Ranch High School was found with a gun on campus, as reported by Principal James Cross.
The student at Cinco Ranch High School was immediately removed from class.
These incidents have heightened concerns over school safety and gun control.
